Name: Bonnet
Description: This openwork bonnet comes from the tomb of Aurelius Colluthus at Antinoopolis. The technique used here is called sprang, with a warp of undyed and red linen. The threads join at the top of the head, forming a point which droops in a fashion similar to a Phrygian bonnet. The Musées de Bruxelles own two other bonnets of linen (ACO.Tx.2478) and one of wool.
